page.syntax: Record_List as C = every_record_list(C order ,N every [,C filter])

argument.name: Record_List
argument.description: A list of the record numbers from the current table.

argument.name: order
argument.description: Optional. Default = "" (record number order). A character order expression that sorts selected records.

argument.name: every
argument.description: A integer number that specifies the interval to sample records. For example: Number = 1 retrieves all records. Number = 2 retrieves every second record. Numeric

argument.name: filter
argument.description: Optional. Default = ".T." (All records). A character filter expression that evaluates to a logical value and selects records from the table.

page.discussion: The EVERY_RECORD_LIST() function returns a list of record numbers. The function samples records, based on the Number parameter. This function should be used in the context of an open layout.

section.title: Example
section.description: This code was placed under the OnPush event of a button on a form. It returns the record number of the tenth record after the table was sorted in lastname order.
